authors.name: Shou Kitahara
authors.note: SK and SR contributed equally to this protocol.

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"29gu0","text":"Genetically engineered mouse model (GEMM) is one of the most important pre-clinical models in cancer research. In pancreatic cancer research, Kras+/LSL-G12D; Trp53+/LSL-R172H; Pdx-1-Cre (KPC) mouse model has been widely used in the laboratory setting, since it faithfully recapitulates the progression of human pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma. Polymerase Chain Reaction (PCR) is commonly used to genotype GEMMs. However, genotyping one gene at a time is inefficient and labor intensive. To simplify the genotyping process, we multiplexed three separate genotyping PCR protocols for a single PCR reaction. In addition, we provided the optimized PCR protocol for determining heterozygous or homozygous status of Trp53LSL-R172Hallele. Overall, this protocol offers cost-efficient and accurate genotyping results for KPC mice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":142,"length":44},{"style":"italic","offset":711,"length":14},{"style":"sup","offset":146,"length":10},{"style":"sup","offset":163,"length":11},{"style":"sup","offset":716,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
disclaimer: {"blocks":[{"key":"3nihm","text":"DISCLAIMER – FOR INFORMATIONAL PURPOSES ONLY; USE AT YOUR OWN RISK","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"deb82","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dgm7","text":"The protocol content here is for informational purposes only and does not constitute legal, medical, clinical, or safety advice, or otherwise; content added to protocols.io is not peer reviewed and may not have undergone a formal approval of any kind. Information presented in this protocol should not substitute for independent professional judgment, advice, diagnosis, or treatment. Any action you take or refrain from taking using or relying upon the information presented here is strictly at your own risk. You agree that neither the Company nor any of the authors, contributors, administrators, or anyone else associated with protocols.io, can be held responsible for your use of the information contained in or linked to this protocol or any of our Sites/Apps and Services.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":160,"length":12},{"key":1,"offset":631,"length":12}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"url":"http://protocols.io"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"url":"http://protocols.io"}}}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"92epb","text":"Introduction","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b2o41","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bm48g","text":"Genetically engineered mouse models (GEMMs) are critical preclinical models that allow researchers to investigate disease progression and therapeutic responses in vivo. In cancer specifically, GEMMs allow researchers to study the means of tumor progression in patients, including tumor initiation, metastasis, and mutational heterogeneity, by aptly recapitulating human cancer characteristics1. To use GEMMs in the laboratory setting, it is necessary to cross individual genetically modified alleles and maintain the desired genotypes.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":160,"length":7},{"style":"sup","offset":392,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8qcel","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d0ce","text":"Mutations in KRAS (Kirsten rat sarcoma viral oncogene homolog) and TP53 are the two most frequently mutated genes in cancers2.For pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC), KRAS mutations are present in about 95% of cases and TP53 are co-present in about 70% of cases3. Therefore, mice with Kras+/LSL-G12D; Trp53+/LSL-R172H; Pdx1-Cre (KPC) are widely used because this model faithfully recapitulates human pancreatic cancer pathogenesis4.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":13,"length":4},{"style":"italic","offset":67,"length":4},{"style":"italic","offset":171,"length":4},{"style":"italic","offset":224,"length":4},{"style":"italic","offset":289,"length":42},{"style":"sup","offset":124,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":265,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":293,"length":10},{"style":"sup","offset":310,"length":11},{"style":"sup","offset":434,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"524uj","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"95baj","text":"It is common practice to isolate genomic DNA from toes, tails, or ears and perform molecular methods like PCR (polymerase chain reaction), Southern blot or dot blot techniques5. In general, the genotyping methods should be rapid and reproducible, and allow for the analysis of large numbers of mice. However, it is still labor-intensive to genotype multiple alleles individually. Mis-genotyping of the alleles could lead to irrevocable consequences6. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":175,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":448,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cacui","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"42coo","text":"Here, we have provided a simple, rapid, and cost-effective multiplex genotyping protocol for KPC mice with crude DNA extracts from tail, toes, or ear biopsy. In addition, we refined the protocol to distinguish the homozygous (homo) alleles for Trp53LSL-R172H from heterozygous (het). This protocol requires a single PCR reaction for three alleles of K (KrasLSL-G12D), P (Trp53LSL-R172H) and C (Cre) as well as an internal positive control without any commercial genomic DNA isolation kit.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":244,"length":14},{"style":"italic","offset":353,"length":12},{"style":"italic","offset":371,"length":14},{"style":"italic","offset":394,"length":3},{"style":"sup","offset":249,"length":9},{"style":"sup","offset":357,"length":8},{"style":"sup","offset":376,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: pancreatic cancer, PDAC, KPC, genotyping, multiplex, Kras, Trp53, Pdx1-Cre

BP152-5)","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"70hha","text":" ii.18.61g Disodium EDTA (Thermo Fisher Scientific, Cat # BP120-1)","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ffgc","text":" iii.57.1 ml Glacial Acetic Acid (Thermo Fisher Scientific, Cat #A38-212)","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"171dk","text":" iv.Double-distilled H2O to 1L","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":29,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"efmmh","text":" v.Dilute 50X to desired volume of 1X with Double-distilled H2O","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":68,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2hp61","text":" ●Gel casting mold and combs","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dqip0","text":" ●Electrophoresis apparatus","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3t6d9","text":" ●6X Loading Dye (NEB, #B7025)","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3i4lt","text":" ●Power Supply ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ajrad","text":" ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2pe91","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cedd8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fmukk","text":"Table 1. Cancer Discov11, 2094-2111 (2021). https://doi.org:10.1158/2159-8290.CD-20-1228","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":15,"length":7},{"style":"italic","offset":142,"length":13},{"style":"bold","offset":155,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":177,"length":44}],"data":{}},{"key":"431ol","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2i1na","text":"4    Hingorani, S. Cancer Cell7, 469-483 (2005). https://doi.org:10.1016/j.ccr.2005.04.023","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":21,"length":7},{"style":"italic","offset":162,"length":11},{"style":"bold","offset":173,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":192,"length":41}],"data":{}},{"key":"fs50c","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f8srp","text":"5    Cinelli, P., Rettich, A., Seifert, B., Burki, K. \u0026 Arras, M. Nature356, 215-221 (1992). https://doi.org:10.1038/356215a0","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":21,"length":7},{"style":"italic","offset":119,"length":6},{"style":"bold","offset":125,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[{"key":6,"offset":146,"length":32}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"5453AA63CEAE11EDB1120A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://doi.org:10.1016/j.tcb.2021.07.003"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"5453AADFCEAE11EDB1120A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://doi.org:10.1038/s41467-021-26213-y"}},"2":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"5453AB63CEAE11EDB1120A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://doi.org:10.1158/2159-8290.CD-20-1228"}},"3":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"5453AC11CEAE11EDB1120A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://doi.org:10.1016/j.ccr.2005.04.023"}},"4":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"5453AC8CCEAE11EDB1120A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://doi.org:10.1258/002367707780378113"}},"5":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"5453AD10CEAE11EDB1120A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://doi.org:10.1038/522151a"}},"6":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"5453A89ECEAE11EDB1120A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://doi.org:10.1038/356215a0"}}}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ec2p6","text":"Prepare Lysis Buffer (Recipe for 10 mL)","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a179u","text":"●0.0121 g Tris-HCl pH 8.0","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3jcv7","text":"●0.0373 g KCl","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9d41u","text":"●12.5 µl 2M MgCl2","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":16,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7m1cj","text":"●45 µL NP-40 ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3l32m","text":"●45 µL Tween-20","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"at30l","text":"●9.9 mL Ultrapure Distilled Water (DW)","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5b60k","text":"Add 3 µl Proteinase K (20 mg/mL) to 1 mL of Lysis buffer prior to use (Store in -20°C)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6h31t","text":"Add 30 µl Lysis buffer with Proteinase K to cut tissue in 1.5 mL tube","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"4e92m","text":"Incubate at 56°C for 1.5 hours","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3pf47","text":"Place on ice briefly and spin down briefly in a tabletop centrifuge ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"39reu","text":"Incubate at 96°C for 10 min in ThermoMixer","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2r3nd","text":"Prepare PCR master mix for KPC in 1.5mL centrifuge tubes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ce66r","text":"10 µL Platinum hot start PCR Mix","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"emtc0","text":"0.4 µL 10 mM primer each (7 primers)","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"el4hp","text":"6.2 µL DW ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"f38ae","text":"Aliquot 19 µL of master mix into each PCR tube","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"7he2t","text":"Add 1 µL DNA template to individual PCR tubes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a7udr","text":"Perform PCR using the following conditions:","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dvj8o","text":"a.94°C 3 min","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fvel3","text":"b.94°C 1 min/ 65°C 2 min/ 72°C 1 min (40 cycles)","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6cq1c","text":"c.72°C 3 min / 4°C ∞ ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b417r","text":"Prepare PCR master mix for Trp53 het/homo in 1.5mL centrifuge tubes","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6n28o","text":"2 µL 10X NEB polymerase buffer","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1pv1k","text":"0.4 µL 10mM dNTP","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"73oti","text":"0.4 µL 10mM primer (4 primers)","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"afllr","text":"0.1 µL Taq polymerase","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1johh","text":"14.9 µL DW","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"d71ul","text":"Aliquot 19 µL of master mix into each PCR tube","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"d28sa","text":"Add 1 µL DNA template to individual PCR tubes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"67eog","text":"Perform PCR using the following conditions:","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a34mi","text":"a.94°C 3 min","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ed430","text":"b.94°C 30sec/ 60°C 30sec/ 72°C 30sec (40 cycles)","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"74uic","text":"c.72°C 3 min / 4°C ∞ ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"9pat","text":"Make 2% agarose gel in TAE buffer","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"72u0","text":"Add 2 µL ethidium bromide (10 mg/ml stock concentration) to 100 ml melted agarose. Swirl to mix.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"5fctv","text":"Pour into the casting mold with combs inserted to set up wells.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c42un","text":"Remove combs and casting mold from agarose gel after the cast harden (~ 30 min)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"1t3cp","text":"Place the gel into electrophoresis apparatus ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"74jf9","text":"Add 1X TAE buffer to electrophoresis apparatus until the gel is submerged","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"26v8l","text":"Add 4 µL 6X loading dye to each 20 µL PCR product and load 10 µL of it into the wells","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"acb37","text":"Load 3 µL of 100 bp DNA ladder mixed with loading dye to 1st well of each lane","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8hhl5","text":"Run gel at 120V until loading dye is visualized 75-80 % down the gel","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4gp8c","text":"Remove the gel from the electrophoresis apparatus and visualize it under UV light","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"80krk","text":"Analyze images to determine the genotype for each mouse","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Multiplex Genotyping PCR for the KPC Pancreatic Cancer Mouse Model
title_html: Multiplex Genotyping PCR for the KPC Pancreatic Cancer Mouse Model
